alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 3:57PM EST until December 17 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 14 inches. The highest snowfall totals will be west of Albany and the Hudson River. Expect generally 5 to 9 inches in extreme eastern Albany and southern Washington Counties. The snow will mix with rainfall tonight into tomorrow before changing back to snow late tomorrow afternoon into tomorrow night.The snow tapers off Saturday morning. * WHERE...Eastern Albany and Southern Washington Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall amounts will vary by elevation with highest totals west of Albany. Snowfall rates may reach one inch per hour at times, especially early Friday morning and again on Friday late afternoon and evening. The snow will mix with or change to rain at times during the day on Friday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
